data.title: Text selection from line number column
data.body:
Click and drag from the line number area should start a text selection in the buffer next to it.  Selecting text from the beginning of the line is unforgiving because there's no padding to the left of the first character.

![atom-selection](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/122102/172885/27287234-7ac9-11e2-938d-9ebe6822e820.png)

data.title: Background windows lose text selection
data.body:
A couple issues with text highlighting:
- Highlight color should match the native blue (see TextEdit as an example).
- When the atom window is in the background, the text highlight color disappears, but should turn into a grey.

TextEdit window in the foreground with blue selection:

![textedit-foreground](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/122102/172825/dc495964-7ac7-11e2-910e-fb6ffc83da67.png)

TextEdit window in the background with grey selection:

![textedit-background](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/122102/172824/dc46d90a-7ac7-11e2-919b-3e5d846d1d4b.png)

Atom window in the foreground with non-native selection color:

![atom-foreground](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/122102/172823/dc014a66-7ac7-11e2-889a-66222d139903.png)

Atom window in the background loses all selection color:

![atom-background](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/122102/172826/dc4997b2-7ac7-11e2-8270-12e2b8d96aab.png)

data.title: Remove CEF from the repo and download it as needed
data.body:
We now use [github/prebuilt-cef](https://github.com/github/prebuilt-cef) to download CEF from S3, then build against that. This means we no longer need to have CEF committed to the repo.

Fixes #280.

data.title: Mouse pointer should change to i-bar when over text buffers
data.body: When the mouse pointer is hovering over a native text input, it changes the to the i-bar.  It would be good to do that when over a code buffer in Atom.

/cc @jonrohan @Caged 

Looks pretty awesome overall however!

data.title: Open main file when the Package Generator creates a package.
Get CEF out of the repo
data.body:
Having CEF checked in to the repo makes the repo big and cloning super slow. I propose we move CEF out of the repo and just download it as needed. Specifically, I propose:
1. We set up a new repo whose sole purpose is to build CEF. Basically we'd take [`script/update-cef`](https://github.com/github/atom/blob/1190644e76d7b99d72c153837124e2ebdf07ad41/script/update-cef) and move it to a new repo.
2. In the new repo, add a `script/cibuild` that
   1. Builds CEF (duh)
   2. Zips it up (with a name that includes the CEF version)
   3. Uploads it to S3
3. Add a file to the github/atom repo that specifies which version of CEF should be used.
4. Change either `script/bootstrap` or `Rakefile` to download and unpack the version of CEF listed in the file.

How does this sound? Basically we'd be creating our own binary releases of CEF and hosting them on S3, then downloading them before building Atom.

If we wanted to get really crazy we could use `git filter-branch` to remove the old versions of CEF. That would shrink the repo and make cloning super :rabbit2::dash:

data.title: Can't preview markdown of an Untitled Document
data.body: Even with the grammar picked, ctrl-m still won't show markdown preview.

data.title: Build a list of all native interactions
data.body: I'd like a list of everything we'd need node-webkit to be capable of before we could switch over to it without loss of capability. I'm curious how many things are really in that list.

data.title: Searching for "test" in .com causes Atom to become unresponsive
data.body:
Do a find in project in the .com codebase for the string "test" and Atom will become unresponsive after a while and continually spit out these errors in the console:

```
Error thrown in OutputHandle
Uncaught Error: The operation couldn\U2019t be completed. (NSCocoaErrorDomain error 256.) undefined:1
undefined undefined:1
Uncaught Error: The operation couldn\U2019t be completed. (NSCocoaErrorDomain error 256.) 
```

It's complaining about this method in `fs.coffee`.  FWIW, Sublime would hang up on .com too.  I think it was a bad symlink. 

``` coffee-script
  # Open, read, and close a file, returning the file's contents.
  read: (path) ->
    $native.read(path)
```

data.title: Allow panes to be resized
data.body: Panels split the difference between the space available.  It'd be nice if we could manually resize them.  Should take a look at what @nakajima did with the tree view.

data.title: Remove `rake run`
data.body: We should be using the `rake install` and `atom` CLI command

data.title: Package generator
data.body:
Based on Issued #130.

Calling the `package-generator:generate` command will create a basic package in ~/.atom/packages. I tried to keep the package as simple as possible but enforce conventions that we use. For example, the generated `package.cson` file includes `activationEvents` so the package won't be loaded synchronously on launch. Hopefully this will feel more natural than a CLI based generator.

I'd like to talk to @jonrohan and @Caged about adding theme generator support.

data.title: Focussed describe not working anymore
data.body: When building plugins I used to always use "fdescribe" to only run a set of specs instead of the entire suite. I first noticed it not working anymore a few weeks ago. Is there a new way to run only a subset of specs?

data.title: Missing directory in file drawer?
data.body:
I opened up github/github in Atom and it appears it doesn't see the `bin` directory:

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1329/153530/4ebc33f8-75fb-11e2-8fc6-2afa6482941e.png)

I can't 'cmd-t' to any files in there either.

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1329/153538/6b148eb0-75fb-11e2-8603-0f44063bcd60.png)

Any ideas?

data.title: Click selections incorrect with Variable width font
data.body:
Now that the caret position respects variable-width fonts, it looks like the mouse cursor position (computed when you click, presumably?) is still reading the click position and interpreting it in terms of fixed-width rows and columns.

Clicking to position the caret:
![var-bug-2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/296432/152631/b3189c66-75cd-11e2-881e-3b20fe9382b1.gif)

Double clicking to select a word:
![var-width-bug](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/296432/152619/598d3cc4-75cd-11e2-8291-68cbdf5aca60.gif)

FWIW The further you click from the beginning of the line, the greater the offset, so I’m fairly sure it’s not just out by a fixed offset.

data.title: Scroll bars appear over fuzzy finder
data.body:
They eventually fade, but when they're visible they show up over the fuzzy finder for me:

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2/151850/91283ed2-759f-11e2-9b5d-0ec63d83f0ff.png)

data.title: Add theme extensions
data.body: Described [in the themes documentation](https://github.com/github/atom/docs/#themes)

data.title: Sort buffers by most recently opened
data.body: This orders the buffers in `meta-b` by the time they were opened. The most recently opened buffer is at the top. The currently opened buffer is at the bottom. This means you can keep hitting `meta-b` to toggle between two files you're working on.

data.title: If no `stylesheets` key is provided in `package.cson` for a theme, load all stylesheets in alpha order
data.body: This is needed to match the documentation. It makes life easier on authors.

data.title: Switch wrap-guide to use editor.preferredLineLength config key
Reconsider the load order
data.body:
Currently the `user.coffee` and keymaps in `~/.atom/keymaps` are loaded before packages load. 

This should probably be reordered to:
- packages load
- user keymaps load
- user.coffee loads

data.title: ~/.atom/keymaps don't override default keybindings
data.body: I tried installing [this package](https://gist.github.com/derekgr/e3a99868ee6ba8c1e786/4a073d4f2a4326381dcba1ec36c05def07a6fc7b) but instead of putting the bindings in my user.coffee I put them in `~/.atom/keymaps/defunkt.cson`. `ctrl-y` worked but `ctrl-k` didn't fire.
